setResourceLoaderForOperationalOverrides

public PropertiesMergerBuilder setResourceLoaderForOperationalOverrides(ResourceLoader resourceLoader)
Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
Sets the resource loader from which to load the environmental properties. This is the location from which to source operationally overridden properties, which can also be overridden on an environmental basis. You would either choose to call this method or it's counter part (which might be easier)

Specified by:
setResourceLoaderForOperationalOverrides in interface PropertiesMergerBuilder
Parameters:
resourceLoader - The resource loader responsible for loading application configuration resources from a location that the operations teams can override values.
Returns:

setLocationForLoadingOperationalOverrides

public PropertiesMergerBuilder setLocationForLoadingOperationalOverrides(String location)
Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
Sets the resource loader from which to load the environmental properties. This is the location from which to source operationally overridden properties, which can also be overridden on an environmental basis. The location is specified via string. This will be prefixed with a controlled volcabulary that is specific to the implementation, an example would be "classpath:/xxx" or "filesystem:/xxx" to specify that the properties are to be loaded from the classpath or filesystem. string.

Specified by:
setLocationForLoadingOperationalOverrides in interface PropertiesMergerBuilder
Parameters:
location - The location from which the application defaults and then the environmental overrides are read
Returns:

Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
Sets the resource loader from which to load the environmental properties. This is the location from which to load the generic properties, that are to be overridden by environmental specific properties. See PropertiesMergerBuilder.setLocationForLoadingConfigurationProperties(String) for specifying the resource Loader via a string.

This will be prefixed with a controlled volcabulary that is specific to the implementation, an example would be "classpath:/xxx" or "filesystem:/xxx" to specify that the properties are to be loaded from the classpath or filesystem. string.

setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration

public PropertiesMergerBuilder setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration(List<List<String>> var)
Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
Sets the list of variables on which the relevant set of resources (properties) will be sourced. I.e. USER, LANG, or more likely on a production platform : ENV, os.arch. This means that the properties resolver would look for a default file (i.e. default.props), and then for a properties file: .properties (i.e. production.properties) to merge on top of the default properties. Then it would look for ..properties (i.e. production.x86_64.properties) to merge on top of those previous properties. [ [ ENV ], [ ENV , os.arch ] ]

Specified by:
setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration in interface PropertiesMergerBuilder
Parameters:
var - A List of a list of environment/system properties, against which to look for override files.
Returns:
The builder

setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration

public PropertiesMergerBuilder setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration(String[] csv)
Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
Sets the list of variables on which the relevant set of resources (properties), via an array of comma separated String values: [ "ENV", "ENV,os.arch" ], will be sourced. This means that the properties resolver would look for a default file (i.e. default.props), and then for a properties file: .properties (i.e. production.properties) to merge on top of the default properties. Then it would look for ..properties (i.e. production.x86_64.properties) to merge on top of those previous properties.

Specified by:
setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration in interface PropertiesMergerBuilder
Parameters:
csv - A List of a list of environment/system properties, against which to look for override files.
Returns:
The builder

getVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration

public String[][] getVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration()
Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
The array of variables the properties (resources), will be sourced/overridden sequentially against. For a call to @link {#setVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration(new String[]{"ENV","ENV,os.arch"})} the returned value would be: [ [ "ENV" ], [ "ENV", "os.arch" ] ]

Specified by:
getVariablesUsedForSwitchingConfiguration in interface PropertiesMergerBuilder
Returns:

setRelativeLocationOfFilesOverridingDefaultProperties

public PropertiesMergerBuilder setRelativeLocationOfFilesOverridingDefaultProperties(String relativeLocation)
Description copied from interface: PropertiesMergerBuilder
The location relative to PropertiesMergerBuilder.setLocationForLoadingConfigurationProperties(String) and PropertiesMergerBuilder.setLocationForLoadingOperationalOverrides(String) from which to read the application properties, which override the defaults, that are source based on environmental or system properties.

Specified by:
setRelativeLocationOfFilesOverridingDefaultProperties in interface PropertiesMergerBuilder
Parameters:
relativeLocation - The relative location in which application overrides based on environmental or system properties are read.
Returns:
A string representing a location relative to the Resource Loaders used for reading application properties and operational overrides

buildProperties in interface PropertiesResolverBuilder
Parameters:

buildProperties

public Properties buildProperties(PropertiesMergerBuilder builder)
Description copied from interface: PropertiesResolverBuilder
Returns a set of properties that are retrieved from the given properties merger (the merger is created from the PropertiesMergerBuilder) with the values resolved of any variables they contained (if they can be resolved)

Specified by:
buildProperties in interface PropertiesResolverBuilder
Parameters:
builder - The builder object that can be used to create a merger that is responsible for reading the properties from the file system; from which the properties are obtained, and the values resolved.
Returns:
the set of the properties, from the merger, with the values resolved of any variables (if possible)

buildResolvedProperties

public Properties buildResolvedProperties()
Description copied from interface: ResolvedPropertiesBuilder
Returns the set of properties, with all embedded property values resolved. The properties themselves come from a set of combined property files that are source dependent on system or environment properties. Any property value that contain variables (placeholders i.e. ${..}) are resolved.

Specified by:
buildResolvedProperties in interface ResolvedPropertiesBuilder
Returns:
